name: Right Levator Scapulae Stretch
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, then slowly bend to one side as far as possible.
2. Slowly lower your body down to the side, allowing your right arm to drape across your right leg and your forearm to rest on the mat or floor behind you. Keep your left hand holding onto a stable surface for support if needed.

3. Hold this position, taking deep breaths and continuing to stretch the muscle on the right side of your neck and back.
4. After 30 seconds or more, slowly return back up to standing upright and then bend to the other side for the opposite side's Levator Scapulae Stretch.
short_summary: The Right Levator Scapulae Stretch is a bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the upper back
